node.title: Blur to play Øya Wednesday 7th of August
node.excerpt: One of the biggest British bands of the last 20 years will play Øya, marking their first live show in Norway in ten years. Blur are set to headline Øya Festival 2013 on Wednesday the 7th of august. We are extremely proud to have a band of this size and recognition confirmed so early. There […]

node.title: First acts confirmed for Øya 2013
node.excerpt: OF MONSTERS AND MEN (IS) TØNES REBEKKA KARIJORD ANGEL HAZE (US) GOAT (SE) MONICA HELDAL OKKULOKRATI The first acts for next year’s Øya Festival are now confirmed. The festival passes will be on sale on Thursday 29th of November, 9.00 a.m. at Billettservice. Tickets can be purchased online, at the post office, 7 Eleven or […]

node.title: The Bell Laboratory released on Rough Trade
node.excerpt: Pantha Du Prince & The Bell Laboratory, the Norwegian-German project which had its live debut at last year’s Øya Festival, will now release an album on Rough Trade Records, which is known to have released records by The Smiths, Throbbing Ghristle, The Strokes, Sufjan Stevens,  Antony & The Johnsons and many more. The two Norwegian […]

node.title: Thank you – see you next year
node.excerpt: Øya 2012 is just over. Through four eventful days in the Medieval Park and a huge amount of club shows, thousands of people enjoyed great music. The concerts have been well attended throughout the festival. Our audience really knows how to create a good atmosphere. The last two days we have also had some of […]

node.title: Frank Ocean cancels mid-show
node.excerpt: Unfortunately, Frank Ocean had to cancel his afternoon concert after just 15 minutes due to acute problems with his voice. We deeply apologise for the inconvenience this may have caused.

node.title: Sei A to play Klubben
node.excerpt: Factory Floor has cancelled their gig tonight   Sei A is playing instead. He will also play Øyanatt at Sukkerbiten Disclosure and Sei A at Sukkerbiten   Statement from Factory Floor: “Due to album recording commitments Factory Floor are unable to make appearances at Way Out West and Oya festivals this summer. We apologise to […]

node.title: Billy Bragg and Savages to play Øya
node.excerpt: We have gotten two cancellations just before the festival starts, and have been working hard to find good replacements. Savages and Billy Bragg comes to the Medieval Park to play on Thursday 9th of August. Both Haim and Here We Go Magic have unfortunately been forced to cancel their European gigs in August. We hope […]

node.title: A few day tickets for sale at the entrance
node.excerpt: There is one last chance to get day passes to this year’s Øya. A a small number of tickets will be on sale at the entrance to the festival from Wednesday to Saturday (only tickets for the same day). The price will be NOK 750, -. We hope this can be a small contribution to […]

node.title: Almost 90 club shows on tuesday 7th of august
node.excerpt: Klubbdagen (The Club Day) is the traditional opening day of Øya, with concerts at our favorite clubs around the city of Oslo. This evening you can experience a lot of fresh new talent. The gigs are included for anyone who has a full festival pass. This year’s edition of the Klubbdagen includes over 85 concerts […]

node.title: The Øya Festival is sold out – Jessie Ware plays Saturday
node.excerpt: Yesterday, the ticket office sold the last tickets to The Øya Festival 2012. This means we sold out in record time. 15,000 people are looking forward to each of the four days in the Medieval Park, and a lot of club shows during the festival week. We cannot wait to get started about six weeks. […]

node.excerpt: Ty Segall, Jacuzzi Boys, Fatboy

node.title: Comfort Hotel Xpress + Øyafestivalen = TRUE
node.excerpt: Ready for some really awesome news? Following up lasts years’ success, we are so very excited to be the only hotel in Oslo to offer a hotel deal including tickets to Øyafestivalen 2012. We only have a limited number of passes, and the only way you can book is by sending an email to festival@choice.no. […]

node.title: Nighttime Øya at Rockefeller and John Dee
node.excerpt: Wednesday 8th of August – John Dee – Nighttime Øya Bowerbirds (US) +  Therese Aune Tickets NOK 125, – + fee with festival pass, NOK 175, – + fee without a festival pass With Bowerbirds on stage, you are guaranteed a nice, relaxed evening with lovely indie folk. Therese Aune plays atmospheric dream pop with […]

node.title: Frank Ocean and Maya Vik
node.excerpt: Frank Ocean will play Thursday 9th of August Maya Vik will play Saturday 11th of August   FRANK OCEAN (US) 24 year-old Christopher Francis Ocean started out as a songwriter for amongst others John Legend and Brandy. He signed with Def Jam at an early stage in his career but unfortunately this collaboration came to […]

node.title: Six new acts!
node.excerpt: BEST COAST (US) – Sat11/8 ODD NORDSTOGA – Sat 11/8 CHROMATICS (US) – Fri 10/8 HERE WE GO MAGIC (US) – Thu 9/8 HEDVIG MOLLESTAD TRIO – Thu 9/8 SWEDEN – day TBA Spring is here and Øya is giving you six more reasons to look forward to the festival summer. The festival program will […]

node.title: Waters, Papa M og Juan Atkins for Nighttime Øya
node.excerpt: Nighttime Øya is the party that continues after the fun in the Medieval Park is over for the evening. Wednesday 8th of August Revolver gets a visit from Waters, a promising band with a special connection to Oslo. Thursday Lot Lot (at Dattera Til Hagen) is serving us one of the founders of techno, Juan […]

node.title: Reggae legends to Øya
node.excerpt: The Congos + Lee «Scratch» Perry + Max Romeo, 10th of August

node.title: Haim (US), Amund Maarud, Reptile Youth (DK) and Casa Murilo
node.excerpt: Four new names are ready for The Øya Festival in August and add to the already strong program. One of the new American bands that have impressed us during the last months are the three sisters of Haim. They were amongst the best bands we saw at SXSW in USA recently. Amund Maarud has for […]

node.title: Baroness at Øya Thursday 9th of August
node.excerpt: Baroness are releasing their third album this year and the expectations have been growing with the fans for months. On Thursday the 9th of August, the Georgia quartet will be playing in the medieval park.   BARONESS (US) This year, Baroness are following up on the amazing album Blue Record, and the expectations for this […]

node.title: Cloud Nothings to The Medieval Park
node.excerpt: A few weeks ago, we released the news that Cloud Nothings will be playing at Øya Open at Revolver on the 16th of May. The ticket sales are going well and it will be a crowded show. We see no other solution than to invite the band behind one of this winter’s strongest albums to […]

node.title: Odd Future are coming to Øya the 10th of August
node.excerpt: Odd Future has been one of the most prominent names within hip hop during the last years, and they are coming to The Øya Festival Friday the 10th of August. They recently released The OF Tape Vol.2, go check it out! This gang will be creating some real atmosphere at Øya on the same day […]

node.title: Friends play Øya on Wedensday
node.excerpt: The main focus in the next days will be new music and artists who have not yet reached a big audience but who we think will become increasingly popular during 2012. The first new act on the line-up is Friends from Brooklyn. Their debut album will be out before the summer. They are playing their […]

node.title: Sundfør, SBTRKT and Eick to Øya
node.excerpt: We can now confirm two more Norwegian acts as well as a brilliant British artist. Susanne Sundfør has just released one of this year’s most anticipated records, following her success The Brothel. Mathias Eick will be performing parts of an exciting commisioned piece along with musicians from the Norwegian jazz elite. It is also confirmed […]

node.title: Mazzy Star, DâM-Funk and Factory Floor at Øya
node.excerpt: The confirmations are pouring in here at the Øya offices, a good reason to look forward to the festival season. It is now confirmed that Mazzy Star are coming to Oslo in August to give us an intimate concert at our smallest stage Wednesday the 8th of August. The funk guru DâM-Funk and the great […]

node.title: Four great rock bands
node.excerpt: THE AFGHAN WHIGS (US) / CEREMONY (US) / DIE A LEGEND / BUSHMAN’S REVENGE The Afghan Whigs recently confirmed that they will be playing concerts again in 2012, after a break lasting for more than ten years. They will be playing at The Øya Festival Thursday 9th of August. In addition to this, we have […]

node.title: Håkon Kornstad play jazz and opera at Øya
node.excerpt: Håkon Kornstad will perform at The Øya Festival with his new project Tenor Battle, where he combines opera and jazz. This is really something else…     HÅKON KORNSTAD TENOR BATTLE Håkon Kornstad had already enjoyed quite an extensive international career as a jazz saxophonist, touring in Europe, USA and Japan with his groups […]

node.title: Bob Mould performs Copper Blue at Øya
node.excerpt: Copper Blue by the American trio Sugar was named the best album of 1992 by NME. Twenty years after this release, you’ll be able to experience the mastermind behind this classic record performing all the ten tracks at The Øya Festival. Bob Mould is only doing a few shows with the material from Copper Blue this […]

node.title: Øya present Norwegian bands at SXSW
node.excerpt: On Friday 16th of March The Øya festival and Music Export Norway present three Norwegian bands as part of Filter Magazine’s program at  South By Southwest (SXSW) in Austin, Texas. Philco Fiction, Razika and Team We will perform for music lovers, media and industry people from almost the entire globe. This will be an excellent […]

node.title: Four great names to Øya
node.excerpt: THURSTON MOORE (US) / KARPE DIEM / FIRST AID KIT (SE) / ST. VINCENT (US) It’s now official that Karpe Diem are headlining our largest stage on the Saturday. First Aid Kit, who recently released the wonderful and successful album The Lion’s Roar, are playing on the same day. We have also confirmed legend Thurston […]

node.title: The Black Keys to play Øya on friday 10th of August
node.excerpt: Finally! The Black Keys are one of the bands our audience really wanted us to book for this year’s festival. They are now confirmed to play on our main stage on Friday 10th of August.

node.title: The Øya Festival release second 7”
node.excerpt: The Øya Festival release their second 7” available exclusively at Rough Trade and at London shows. Featured artists Young Dreams and Razika perform two nights in London at The Lexington on Thursday 23rd February and Koko’s Club NME on Friday 24th February. Following the huge success of their inaugural release featuring Lucy Swann and Team […]

node.title: Florence + The Machine at Øya Wednesday 8th of August
node.excerpt: We can now confirm that Florence + The Machine are playing at Øya Wednesday the 8th of August. The new Norwegian pop group Heyerdahl are also confirmed.

node.title: Øya take Razika and Young Dreams to London
node.excerpt: The Øya festival and Music Export Norway are taking Young Dreams and Razika to London late February to perform at two big Øya evenings. We will also be releasing a vinyl single with the two bands, in collaboration with the prestigious Rough Trade.

node.title: Four great artists for Øya
node.excerpt: A$AP Rocky (US) / Susanna / Nicolas Jaar – live in concert (US) / Lars Vaular

node.title: Feist and more to Øya – ticket sales hit record high
node.excerpt: FEIST (CA) / MIRROR LAKES / HIGHASAKITE With names like Bjork, Bon Iver, The Stone Roses and Ane Brun in place for this year’s festival, ticket sales have reached a record high. The number of week passes sold is already the same as in early April last year. We are now releasing another three exciting […]

node.title: Azealia Banks at Øya
node.excerpt: Azealia Banks was recently in first place on NME’s annual cool list. This hiphop artist will definitely be on many people’s lips next year. We look forward to presenting her at Øya.
